intro: Barbaceniopsis boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian barbaceniopsis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the high-altitude regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants found in tropical and subtropical environments. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup, which collects water and nutrients from the surrounding environment. Its flowering stems produce small, clustered inflorescences with vibrant, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Barbaceniopsis boliviensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
